chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon L. Kell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. 

No possession of alcohol. 

No going on premises whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA sample. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

Defendant was sentenced on 5/15/17 and sentence STAYED pending appeal; Stay was lifted on 2/27/19.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/treatment if deft qualifies.

records.addlTxt: AMENDED Notice of Appeal

IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a notice of appeal is extended to November 8, 2017; by November 8, 2017, counsel for Damon L. Kell shall file with the clerk of the circuit court an amended notice of appeal with a proper electronic signature.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that if the amended notice of appeal is filed, the requirement of Wis. Stat. Rule 809.11(2) of transmittal of the notice and circuit court record of the case is waived; it is only necessary for the clerk of the circuit court to forward the amended notice of appeal to this court by supplemental record return within five days of its filing.
Index Item #10 - Exh list - Exh 1 - Squad Video DVD - rec'd at COA on 10-27-2017

Calendar call on June 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202.  No driving without IID as required.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:23 pm 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (OAR)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: $2452 inclusive; DNA sample; 6 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment if def qualifies and 45 days to report; 36 month dl revocation with admin credit; 36 months IID; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol; no possession of alcohol; no going upon premises whose primary business is the sale of alcohol; 6 pts against dl. 
COURT finds the def entilted to 2 days jail credit. 

Atty Abernethy-Mays requests sentence be STAYED pending appeal. 
COURT grants STAY of proceedings. 
CC set for 6/14/2017 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to see if appeal is filed. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays makes requests re: bond. 
No objection. 
COURT modifies bond and removes day reporting requirement - def to return tomorrow to sign amended bond.
